column2: Makes ready to capture a coastal settlement.
This decree has improved the loyalty of our nobles, as such security at home improves our standing abroad tenfold.
Time and tide wait for no man, but Roman walls still stand strong.
Strat Clut Separatists get the following bonuses:
Your faction is upgraded with the following additional bonuses:
Increases this army's campaign map marching range.
Research rate has increased in your land due to recent political events.
It would appear that your investment has paid off - the kingdom is now a far safer place, if the attack comes from without at leastâ€¦
The native population are resistant to the sudden change in leadership. They will come to accept their fate with time...
Friendly relations are key if men are to find greater understanding; when the fair is held, such warmth is promoted.
This year the coffers were found to be empty; the people's disappointment is tangible.
War has come, and so all resources must be marshalled to ensure it is brought to a successful conclusion.
Very soon, you will have no need of others to guide your course.
A player on the world stage, no less, and worthy of respect.
Your sovereignty over these islands is beyond dispute - you are ruler of all you survey... for now at least.
Let all acknowledge that we have come as masters to rule.
From small beginnings do vast empires grow.
Such growth so quickly is bound to attract the wrong kind of attention.
Everyone has learned of, and few dispute, your growing ascendancy.
They never knew what hit them - the very definition of a 'lightning' raid!
In return for granting them land, a noble has used their resources for our gain.
In return for granting them land, a noble has used their resources for our gain.
There has been much tumult from the heavens - strong winds are matched by torrential rain, furious thunder and lightning strikes.
Having considered the matter from every conceivable angle, the learned Witan have reached their conclusion.

Your power is both feared and coveted.
What doesn't kill an army makes it stronger. Investing in the army is money well spent.
What doesn't kill an army makes it stronger. Investing in the army is money well spent.
Your power is of little consequence to the world...yet!
Word of your achievements has travelled far.
Your have estabilished yourself as a worthy power.
This decree has ensured that our armies are content, with all the supplies - and fresh recruits - they need to campaign on home soil.
Today, the wind was not at your backs, leading to defeat in the field.
Embrace the coming religion and this strange new age where all people, not just your warriors, have a voice.
Embrace the coming religion and this strange new age where all people, not just your warriors, have a voice.

This decree has boosted our naval power considerably and secured the sea trade on which we rely.
There are those among the nobility who have further enriched themselves at your expense; such is the price of fealty it seems.
In return for granting them land, a noble has used their resources for our gain.
North Sea Empire gets the following bonuses:
What is that beast all girded with iron, which kills the flocks? He has eight horns but no head, and runs as he pleases.
This decree has undoubtedly improved our standing in the Lord's eyes, for he rewards us with knowledge for our advancement.
Despite some very hard talk, these discussions have not ended in an agreement.
The people will be happier that gold has been invested wisely, rather than just enriching the wealthy further.

Carry on at this rate and rumours of your demise will require no exaggeration!\n\nIncrease legitimacy by owning cultural land, make cultural allies and defending allies. Legitimacy naturally declines as time passes.

You have betrayed and stolen and taken at will; now, no one trusts you.\n\nIncrease legitimacy by owning cultural land, make cultural allies and defending allies. Legitimacy naturally declines as time passes.

Security at home is essential if a ruler is to be successful; recognition of legitimacy by peers and subjects is a vital part of that.\n\nIncrease legitimacy by owning cultural land, make cultural allies and defending allies. Legitimacy naturally declines as time passes.

You have proved your worth to your peers - there will be no further challenges to your rule from within.

Welsh Kingdoms get the following bonuses:
The raging winds have damaged buildings here, depriving the population of much-needed protection against the wild elements.
Some characteristics cannot be learned, but instead are bestowed upon the individual before they are even born. \n\n[[rgba:255:255:255:1]]When this trait groups is active:[[/rgba]]
Objects collected along life's winding track may prove vital at some later juncture.
This decree has ensured that improvements to the military have occurred, pleasing both our soldiers and the people they must protect.
In return for granting them land, a noble has used their resources for our gain.
In return for granting them land, a noble has used their resources for our gain.
An agreement has been made; mercantile endeavours can now flourish and grow.
The road was long, with many a winding turn. Now, the journey is over, and for the travellers, life can begin again.
This decree has softened the blow of high taxation, exchanging payment in gold for the payment in kind of future goodwill.
Civil war has broken out - usurpers seek to overthrow the crown!
It's quite simple - people will respect the throne or face the consequences!
This decree has given us advantage, unseen at first, but now our advanced research will put us clearly ahead of our rivals.

War fervour measures your people's appetite for war. It's affected by the number of wars you are in as well as whether you border your opponents. Decrees, faction leader influence, as well as unique faction mechanics can all impact your factions War Fervour.\n\nOn higher difficulty settings you lose more war fervour for each war you are engaged in.

Decrees, faction leader influence, as well as unique faction mechanics can all impact your factions War Fervour.\n\nOn higher difficulty settings you lose more war fervour for each war you are engaged in.

Decrees, faction leader influence, as well as unique faction mechanics can all impact your factions War Fervour.\n\nOn higher difficulty settings you lose more war fervour for each war you are engaged in.
People are displeased that their creativity is being stifled and are blaming you for their predicament. Sometimes, you just can't win!
The return of the Stone of Destiny to its rightful owner increases your influence and, therefore, loyalty to your rule. Income from churches increases also as a result.
Friendlier relations with the East Engle are in both your interests.
In return for granting them land, a noble has used their resources for our gain.
Your faction is upgraded with the following additional bonuses:
Share the money with the army

Sound investment has a habit of paying off. Your generals are both empowered and emboldened by the training afforded them - this should translate to success in battle, ensuring the kingdom grows exponentially.
Sensibly, these people have placed themselves under your protection.

War has reached our borders! The entire wealth of the kingdom should be committed to the military!\n\nThe burghal level can be changed by adjusting the tax level in the economy screen. Some strange malady has broken out among the cattle; this mysterious pestilence has made them mad!

This man wears the crown with pride, taking his role very seriously indeed.
All look to the king as an example, for he represents the very best in men.
This king has enemies everywhere; chances are, he's not long for this world.
To describe this king as weak would be something of an understatement.
People spit this king's name when it comes up in conversation, so unpopular is he.
He calls himself king? This man is not worthy of such a title!
This king has a good hold on their kingdom, becoming greatly influential on all levels of society.
People smile when they hear this king's name, so benevolent is his rule.
No one thinks anything bad about this king, but then again, they don't think anything good either.
The best thing said of this king is that his reign has proved stable. Hardly a glowing report!
Stripping a noble's estate has caused them to replace the lost land with riches...
The Senate and the People of Rome
Cash may be slipping through your fingers at an astonishing rate, but at least your grip on the throne remains firm.
The Isles are experiencing a great harvest! There is food aplenty and none shall go hungry.

[HIDDEN] Player only effect bundle that increases factionwide upkeep by 2% for each additional army

By their very nature, these things involve a degree of risk; this time, the gamble did not pay off.
In return for granting them land, a noble has used their resources for our gain.
Enriching yourself at the expense of the army will no doubt have... consequences.
Enriching yourself at the expense of the army will no doubt have... consequences.
As the initial joy of the feast fades, the people are left feeling like their leader is trying to buy their support.

Oddly, in their efforts to prove legitimacy, all sorts of nebulous documents are now coming to light, and from every corner of the realm!
Bonus to Faction Allegiance from the king holding Religious Estates.
This decree, ratified by the Witan, has improved the loyalty and allegiance of our subjects for the benefit of the entire kingdom.
Friendlier relations with the Great Viking Army are in everybody's best interests.
The king's conversion has found great favour amongst both his people and the neighbouring powers. However, abandoning the old ways may not sit so well with the nobility.

This decree has enabled us to maintain our road system, helping the kingdom to function and our armies to swiftly act should invaders come calling.
Despite the very best intentions, this adventure has come to naught.
You've asserted your authority. Hopefully, this has put a stop to dark mutterings among the nobility.
There can be no tyrants where there are no slaves, and there's good money to be made from selling flesh!\n\nGain slaves by winning battles and raiding, sacking or occupying settlements.

When the time is right, an expedition can set sail to further your factionâ€™s trade, influence and territorial designs.

To go against the will of God? Such a thing courts pestilence, famine and death, to go with all the wars, that we might know His displeasure. The people know this instinctively - why not so their monarch?

Naturally, when God is pleased He bestows on them the gift of prosperity upon his people, that they may praise Him all the more. Investing in the people's spiritual wellbeing can only pay dividends in the long run, surely?
Share the money with the people

Work maketh the man, the kingdom, the world. \n\n[[rgba:255:255:255:1]]When this trait group is active:[[/rgba]]
Your armies cannot move as swiftly while being trained, but their fighting skills are increased in return.
Increases this fleet's campaign map navigation range.
Once again, the world is experiencing a darkening; lower temperatures and crop failures abound due to the lack of light and warmth.
This glorious verse has raised our people up, boosting our unity and courage to strive ever onward towards a truly united Wales.
Faction Allegience has increased in your land due to recent political events.
Friendlier relations with Strat Clut are in both your interests.
Some are born to conquer, others born to serve; the natural order has been confirmed.

Your faction has run out of money; your people and armies will suffer as a result.

There are now more heroes in this land than blood being spilled in its defence!

You have proved the legitimacy of your lineage; your leadership is now beyond question.

Your faction consumes exactly the same amount of food as it produces â€“ a delicate position to be in.
Nature and nurture, in tandem, define the measure of a man.
Yr Hen Ogledd gets the following bonuses:
The English are truly happy; it seems there is much joy to be gleaned from their green and pleasant land.

It would appear that the English are placated, at least for now. Everyone else is probably safer as a result!\n\nIncrease English happiness by enacting decrees, researching Civic technologies, and making peace with other factions.
The English boil with anger! The lion strains at its leash!\n\nIncrease English happiness by enacting decrees, researching Civic technologies, and making peace with other factions.
The lion is loose and rampant - the English are incandescent with rage!\n\nIncrease English happiness by enacting decrees, researching Civic technologies, and making peace with other factions.
We've butchered a portion of our herds to provide for the people.

Friendlier relations with Gwined are in both your interests.
Your people are happy and are eager to join your armies.
This settlement is recovering from recent flooding. Restoration efforts are underway, but the people live in despair at the event.
This decree has ensured that our hoards are well spent, as more churches and abbeys can only benefit the kingdom.

The recent feast has put a dent in your food supply. Another feast cannot be held until your food supply recovers.

Your armies contain just the right number of levy units to absorb the enemy's arrows!\n\nCan recruit levy units based on the number of owned settlements.
This decree has improved the loyalty and allegiance of our subjects for the benefit of the entire kingdom.
Friendlier relations with the Scots are in everybody's best interests.
This decree has ensured that our hoards are well spent, improving the loyalty of those who govern locally so that we may safely attend to national matters.

Common sense has prevailed - these people have become your vassals.
Bandits are running rampant in this region! If public order does not improve this could cause our people to rebel!
Our fleets are currently exploring new lands far from Britannia. It will not be long before they return with great riches and plunder!

War fervour measures your people's appetite for war. It's affected by the number of wars you are in as well as whether you border your opponents. Decrees, faction leader influence, as well as unique faction mechanics can all impact your factions War Fervour.\n\nOn higher difficulty settings you lose more war fervour for each war you are engaged in.
